ratings.question_text: Which of the following best describes your mode of learning in this course?
options: virtual seminar or other discussion format
in-person seminar or other discussion format

ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of <u>intellectual challenge</u> of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the <u>workload</u> of this course was:

narratives.question_text: Please list any other mode(s) of learning, including any combination or variation of the above options.

What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Great foundation of writing, specifically how to form a solid argument and use evidence.
I learned a lot in this class. I became more confident in my writing abilities and learned how/what it means to write at the college level.

I learned how to greatly improve my writing overall. From beginning to end, I was able to polish my skills. I learned how to improve my revision process, how to make my paper clearer, and connect my points effectively.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved? (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: I loved the topic of the class and the freedom we had to bring it in the direction of our choice. The sources we used were so interesting, and Sam is great. Such a great group of students, too--I love the small class size!
I think one of the biggest strengths of this class was that Professor Steinmetz was always willing to help and meet with you.

There strength is that the professor is wonderful. There is very quick feedback on every assignment and we are able to easily reach the professor if there are any questions. The one-on-one meetings have been very helpful in guiding my writing and revising processes. Overall there has been very strong support from my peers in this course as well as the professor.
the course topic is very focused, so the writing assignments can become a bit repetitive

narratives.question_text: Among the practices in this course geared toward learning during the COVID-19 pandemic, which succeeded and which could be improved? Please comment on course practices that allowed for virtual engagement. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: Overall the course was wonderful and adjusted well to the COVID-19 pandemic. It was done through virtual discussion format, and all materials were also made available online for easy access.
the use of breakout rooms in this class really allowed us to collaborate/get acquainted with peers unlike other courses

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain. (Your anonymous response to this question may be viewed by Yale College students, faculty, and advisers to aid in course selection and evaluating teaching.)
comments: YES!!!! I have so many great things to say about this class. The topic, the professor, everything. I learned so much and I truly think I became a much better writer just in a few months. The homework and papers are really interesting and I enjoyed doing them a lot. I will miss this class next semester!

Yes I would love to recommend this course to other students because they can grow a lot as a writer. This course is especially great for those who do not have a strong writing background and would like to develop their skills.
if you want direct, objective feedback on your writing, this is a great class
